reviewText:
It has a fabulous story line.  The use of female agents in WWII is reinforced again.
The acting is great.  Only draw back is it is in French - my wife does not
like to read script.

It's 1944 and Churchill's SOE group has their sights set on Normandy. A captured British geologist threatens to ruin everything and quite possibly, turn the tide of the war in the German's favor. They must retrieve him from the clutches of the Gestapo in France...and they trust 5 women and one man to the task.

There's a former prostitute in prison for a killing a man. She's recruited in exchange for her life. She surprised me and quickly became a favorite. Louise...is the leader, the one who feels responsible. She's hardened, and I suppose she must be after watching her husband shot before her very eyes. There's some former dancer who romanced a Nazi officer. I didn't quite "get" her. Woman four is a young blonde, and the fifth is a Jewish Italian nurse who takes no nonsense.

The movie is action packed and suspenseful. Shooting, torture, secrets, jumping from airplanes, escaping the Gestapo. You never know who is going to be shot next or what plans will go awry. Naturally, nothing goes according to plan, and the women are constantly fleeing for their lives or regrouping...or worse. Not everyone can withstand torture...

There's nudity. Some made perfect sense, such as the dancers distracting the hospital soldiers, but some of it didn't--the weird death scene in which the girl took all her clothes off... I couldn't figure that out.

As I said above, the former prisoner/woman of ill repute became a favorite of mine, though Louise and the Italian woman were very strong too. I could have done without Suzy and the blonde.

I must say though, the characterizations were somewhat poorly done. My favorite woman made it clear she just wanted to take the money and run after the first task, what she'd agreed to, but then suddenly she became the most gung-go, the most determined to complete the next assignment. It was never explained, this change in her demeanor. And Suzy confused me.

I have a huge quibble: The movie is French and thus has English subtitles, but when they speak English, there is nothing, no captioning for the hearing impaired, nada. Thankfully these scenes are minor and I could get the gist of what was going on, but it made me disgruntled nevertheless.

The best part though is that apparently this movie was inspired by a real woman (Louise's character) named Lis de Baissac and I feel that it made a great tribute to the women who helped Normandy come to pass and thus, won the war.
This was a nice escape from the usual and or typical War movies. Acting and direction was excellent. Really enjoyed it.

This was exciting, well written story of the second world war.  The story gave you a unvarnished view of activity behind enemy lines & the problems faced by people especially women in war.  The only problem is it does not worry about showing raw actions, & not for a prude.

The movie is rated TV14, so I was taken by surprise when there was a strip-tease dance and several (five I think) scenes with extended upper female nudity. I wish I'd known that before purchasing the movie. I am very interested in World War II stories, and this one was intriguing. There was just enough suspense, lots of period costumes (perhaps a little overdone). The violence was honest, too brutal for youngsters but true to the time. Considering the nudity and violence, the rating is misleading and should be changed. This is not a movie for kids or anyone who does not have a grasp of what occurred at this point in the war and how high the stakes really were.

"The Female Agents" is a movie based very loosely on the true life of Lise Villameur/Lise de Baissac, who was one of the heroines of the SOE (Special Operations Executive). She was parachuted into France in September 1942 where she helped to set up a safe house in Poitiers. Her older brother Claude had first joined the SOE, and she had followed once they had admitted women.

The movie is based around an apparently fictional story of the coerced recruiting of female resistance fighters, the rescue of a scientist, and then the attempted murder of a German colonel. Sophie Marceau portrays Lise's character in the movie. In real life Lise had lived on a busy street near the Gestapo HQ, and had became acquainted with the Gestapo chief, Herr Grabowski. She had no radio and would have to transfer intelligence by traveling to Paris, or Bordeaux, where her brother, Claude, was developing the Scientist network.

The movie, directed by Jean-Paul Salome (Arsene Lupin), is a well made and suspenseful drama that sheds some light on a little known side of the resistance in France.

While French title Les Femmes de l'Ombre may aspire to Jean-Pierre Melville, English translation Female Agents is closer to the mark, though this surprisingly well reviewed but increasingly hokey story of a quintet of French SOE agents in occupied France might have been more accurately called Ou Babes Audace. Its group of poorly defined stereotypes led by Sophie Marceau at her most coldly unlikeable are sent to rescue a British geologist on whom the success of D-Day depends from a German army hospital in Normandy, which they manage with unlikely ease with a couple of nurses outfits, a striptease show and a lot of unlikely machinegun fire and explosions, but it turns out the gals have been misled by Marceau's estranged brother and superior in the SOE Julien Boisselier. They're also expected to assassinate a German SS officer with a severe case of vertigo (the Hitchcock kind - he's searching for a double of the French girl who jilted him at the altar and ran off to England), and wouldn't you know it, team member Marie Gillain isn't just a dead ringer for her, she actually is his ex. From then on, what had been a fairly handsomely mounted, efficient but not terribly exciting potboiler becomes an increasingly absurd mess of increasingly moronic and unconvincing contrivance and coincidence-prone hokum that loses most of its relation to reality and sheds IQ points by the reel. Naturally, the girls keep on fudging their mission for no other reason than to kill off another member of the team until it has become so nonsensical that it's threatening to outstay what little welcome it has left.

There's not much room for characterisation until the last third, which is leaving it a bit late for us to care about anyone. Moreau is at her most determinedly disagreeable, something the script does at least briefly try to address by having one character note that "Pity isn't your strong point. Try to be a little bit human for once." Unfortunately when she does it simply shows up her limitations, putting you in mind more of Frasier Crane's ex-wife Lilith than the likes of Odette Sanson or Violette Szabo, though she has more to work with than the clichd dilemmas facing the other characters. Will the one-time collaborator sleep with her ex or kill him? Will cynical death row whore Julie Depardieu discover idealism? Will the nice Catholic girl Deborah Francois commit suicide to avoid torture? Will a CGi-resurrected Anton Diffring and Ferdy Mayne turn up for old clichs sake? These people simply act like they're in an old war movie rather than real people, going through scenes designed as would-be movie setpieces rather than convincing or involving drama. Small wonder that Moritz Bleibtrau's German villain is the closest the film has to a convincing character: he at least behaves as if he belongs in the time and place more often than not.

There's some cynicism thrown in along the way to try to make it all seem less clichd - it's the De Gaullist in the group who cracks instantly under the threat of torture and betrays them while a black marketeer is neatly derided: "Start with the Germans, end the war with the Brits. How French can you get?" But at times it feels more cynical itself, with just enough tits and Tommy guns to help sell a few more tickets - director Jean-Paul Salom even makes sure that one girl is given a gratuitous full frontal nude suicide scene. When a final caption informing us that 'this film is dedicated to the women who fought against Nazi barbarity' comes up you almost expect the words 'and got their tits out doing it' to appear. Not too many pluses - the action scenes aren't very convincing, though a scene on the Metro almost works despite its unlikeliness - but at least Maya Sansa makes an impression in the film's most underwritten role. The 2-disc edition of the UK PAL DVD includes Deborah Francois' semi-improvised audition scene that hints at a more interesting film that could have been made if co-writer-director Salom had been more interested in exploring the characters, but the film he ended up making is at best overlong hokum.

This movie ran smoothly and sillily for its entire length. While mildly entertaining the storyline was so silly it was close too humorous - but even there it left no mark.

In many ways it reminded me of Valiant (the Animated Movie), both seem to be set with a single premise - eg. Women fought in WW2 or Animals played their part in WW2 etc. Then both are extremely poorly handled.

The merits of this film are that there is enough going on for it to entertain (mildly) and serveral actresses are pretty to look at - Sophie Marceau is very elegant and there is detail in period settings. For this it gets 2 stars.

The plot is entirely fiction and silly to boot.

Not recommended.

I loved this film. It comes with a bonus disc...the making of the film etc.
Based on a true event. Historical accuracy could be questioned but that is not that important to me. It kept my attention from start to finish.
Purchased from Amazon UK. Very well priced.
There are a number of very well priced DVD's from Amazon UK that are not available here..ie foreign films. ie Inimate Enemies (FR) Do a calculation (Google) from Pounds to Euro to CDN or US. Delivery was about a week. Used VISA.  No customs duties. Approx $14 CDN.
I had to make a backup copy to play on NSTC. Uk is PAL version.
Check out IMDB for synopsis and Amazon UK for reviews.
This is a great adventure/action film set in World War II.  With the nudity, however, you will not want to watch it with your family.

Ok, so this isn't the best plot or most realistic war movie ever made.  The production quality is more "tv-series" level, with a thin plot and leaps of faith.  It seemed quite amazing that each of the women chosen for this dangerous heroic commando mission happened to be so very good looking.

But, why 4 stars then?  I really enjoyed watching this movie.  The actors took there roles quite seriously, and were compelling.  It's a great story.  Most importantly, I woke up still thinking about the movie in a "moved" way the next morning, and that tells me that this movie was worth my time and I'm glad I saw it.
Great French  War movie.

Appreciative of French films, I approached viewing this film with some enthusiasm. In the event I was, however, disappointed. Despite all its glowing reviews, this had the feeling of a made-for-TV film or even a TV mini-series. Reviews I read had me preparing myself for something very grim and gritty. In  the event those scenes of nudity and torture, which I  had braced myself for, were considerably more sanitised and far more soft-edged than I would normally expect from a product of the French cinema. While the acting was quite good, I felt the cast were handicapped by an increasingly weak script which didn't exploit the potential of the basic story and was something of a mess. A film which could and should have been vastly better.

Great WWII movie, with brave and fragile French women who risked everything to save their country and the world from the Nazis.  Based on true events.  Great acting, dialogue, script, can't say enough.  Subtitled (English subtitles with French audio).  It's worth reading the subtitles and I belive you'll be glad you did.  I never knew that women parachuted in WWII.  Don't miss this if you enjoy WWII movies.
Still at it today. My hat off and respect given. Cheers.
good movie.

Set during the period leading up to 'D-Day' landings June 1944, this 'French' film based on true events tells the story of a group of 'Female-Agents being given the task of protecting the secret of the planned 'Normandy' landings,placing themselves in dangerous situations in 'German' occupied regions of 'France'
The film is mainly sub-titled but don't let that deter you from at least watching the film, it is, no question a damn good watch.
Superb Picture and Sound Quality.

I love any movie to do with WW2. So, I liked it a lot.
It's a niche movie. Must see if you are a history buff like myself.

I really enjoyed the completeness of this film. I never expected Sophie Marceau to tackle the type of film, but she surprised me. The roles acted by the actors hold true to past and soon to occur entanglements. I intend to watch this one or more times to really get into the nuances of the many sub-plots. I found this to really adhere to the historical facts of the era.
Powerful story and very well made movie. Excellent acting and directing.
Great movie
even though it was sub titled, it was almost like they were speaking English, because the story was so good.
Great movie!

We loved this movie.  I had my doubts thinking it would be a weird "Charles Angles" sort of thing but I was wrong.  You forget the movie is subtitled because you can't take your eyes off it for a minute.  You almost begin to think that you are understanding French and German.  Action packed, great acting and effects.  This is a sleeper that should be known world wide instead of most of the crap coming out of Hollywood today.  I'm going to say nothing more....you're just going to have to watch it.

Marceau is good in this movie.  Overall Ok, kind of interesting but got unrealistic towards the end.  People tortured to within an inch of their lives walking around and looking good less than 24 hours later.  A German assassination target standing alone where he can easily be picked off.  One treat is Volker Bruch is in this movie.  He had a minor role in this movie unfortunately.  He played one of the lead characters in Generation War which I highly recommend if you like European movies (Generation War is a mini series).

Just watched Dirty Dozen, and this movie started out in a similar manner.  It was done well, and as one who normally watches with captions on for hearing impaired, the CCs didn't bother me at all!  Sophie Marceau has always been terrific.  I had no idea this was based on a true story until the end.  Very good!
Enjoyed this movie.
. . . And almost worth $2.99

There was no warning that the movie was not an english speaking feature. Usually Amazon is quite good about waring its customers that movies are "sub-titled" or spoken in a language other than english. Not so in this case and once it became obvious that this was a forgien language film I immediately stopped it and am asking for a credit from Amazon for another film. This is the first time this has happened to me and I'm curious how Amazon will handle it! At the very least they should warn other potential customers that this is a forgien language film.
Excellent and compelling and mesmerizing!
Good acting. Great story. Like the WW2 movies. Based on actual events. Shows what it took to help with  the war. No easy feat.
Loved it!
Movie in French & German. Have to read English sub-titles. GARBAGE! Certainly NOT worth the money. You need to delete it from your index.

I am not a History Professor so cannot attest to the entire film being 'accurate'.however have been reading history all my life and lived in Europe and like, really good films.  This held my attention and I was not disappointed at all - what bravery those women demonstrated during WWII  !  I am always interested in these films, 'based on fact'..about WWII and the SOE and other amazing stories of those that sacrificed their lives in the fight against such evil aka Nazi Germany.

This movie was OK yet to me these woman agents were too emotional to be effective in their roles as agents it was hard to believe these characters could kill anybody in a war.
The story and mission was good yet it was too limited in scope to certain elements so it was somewhat disappointing.

Good try but better story and actors ..

love the true stories...the hidden stores of ww2 are always interesting.
The french dislike of english I found sorta suprising..

Great WW2 movie about D-day. I was surprised it was good .Bad thing- It does have English subtitles but should have been done with English spoken instead. This women was an assassin for the British S.O.E .

...but interesting enough for this American, too. I only watched it, because Sophie is in it. Her character (based upon the story of a woman who died at 98!) is one lucky agent. I've now seen several films of the French resistance in action, and I suspect that an objective history would make for interesting reading.
A beautifully pictured narrative with a powerful story delivered in a way that helps one appreciate the poignant and the horrific all at once.

this movie owes a lot to the scenery and modern understanding of the time in which it is portraying. we are all aware of the severity and ruthlessness of tactics applied by both sides in the war and this movie makes no secret of them. it draws heavily on past films of this genre for unseen connections and deliveries, the ladies' supplies and contacts all seem to arrive and work off camera, the amount of information in the film considered 'understood' is high. i enjoyed the performances of each actress and they broght tenderness, intelligence, and cold resolve to the work itself.

What I liked the least about it was that it wouldn't play in my DVD recorder.  All my other DVD's that I own work just fine but this DVD just kept saying "can't play ". It was too much of a hassle to return it so I have it sitting on my shelf feminine every day how screwed up Amazon is!
Nice dvd. Condition exactly as described, and delivered very quickly.

Intense WWII drama about  fierce French women who join the resistance. It's well acted, and it's a good, if sad story. If you like WWII stories about France's struggle against the Nazis, I recommend this film.
Excellent story.
An excellent WW11 spy movie.  And, it is true.
Very good, must see, age of 13, Family Time, Good History
Terrible customer service for a pricy movie

Not compelling.  Stayed confused with the AGENTS, who's who?.  Jumped from location to location and Sophie Marceau's beauty is well hidden, sad.  Disappointed with the sexuality of the film for being French and starring Sophie Marceau.

Although the stereotype of France in WW2 is contrary, this movie well tells and educates of the sacrifices and bravery of the French resistance.  If you can't visit the Caen Peace Museum, this is the next best thing.  Great performances throughout and wonderful cinematography propel this story along.  A story well worth telling.
Exellent movie. The director managed to keep me on the edge of my seat without overly bloody graphic violence. Sophie Marceau is outstanding.
